ovdesc.p: The TELLER.PARAMETER file is a general parameter file for the teller system.
It defines the category and transaction codes to be used for balancing tills, the category(s) to be used for cash, rounding details for local currency and the vault id.

Specifies the id of the vault as defined on the TELLER.ID file.

This defines which teller id is the vault. The vault differs from normal teller operations in that it cannot be opened or closed and the only transactions allowed are transfers to and from the teller cash accounts. Multiple vaults are allowed.
The vault should be entered here BEFORE entering the id on the TELLER.ID file
4 Numeric characters.

Defines the method for calculating local equivalents and hence deriving marketing exchange profit.

Input of "NONE" or leaving this field blank means that no market exchange profit will be calculated during TELLER transactions. The local equivalent of one of the transaction is calculated and is assumed to be the local equivalent of the other side.
The option "MIDDLE" will indicate that local equivalents will be calculated using middle rates for corresponding currency markets.
Market exchange profit is then calculated as
LOCAL.AMT.1 - LOCAL.AMT.2 when DR.CR.MARKER = "CREDIT"
and
LOCAL.AMT.2 - LOCAL.AMT.1 when DR.CR.MARKER = "DEBIT"
Optional field. Defaults to NONE. Options NONE or MIDDLE or null.

Specifies the category codes used to define the teller cash accounts.
The teller's cash accounts are defined using the currency, category code and the teller id. Only these accounts will require reconciliation with the till balances when the till is closed.

In Teller Transaction, if charges and taxes are defined, normally, the charge and tax amount will be deducted from the related credit or debit transaction of the customer and accounting entries will be raised for the net amount only.
It is also possible to split the entries, as one for full transaction amount and the others for the charge, tax related amounts.
This field is used to split the charges and tax amounts as separate entries, from the credit or debit transaction amount of the account to which the charges and tax are attached.
If 'YES' is defined in this field, the system will generate separate accounting entries for the charges and taxes attached to the credit or debit transaction, instead of netting them.
If 'YES' is not defined and left blank, the charge/ tax amount will be adjusted with the respective debit or credit transaction and accounting entry will be raised for the net amount only.
This feature is not available for transactions done through Multi -line Teller.
Example:
A cash deposit in a customer account of USD10000 has a charge of USD100 and tax of USD10.
If SPLIT.CHRG.ENTRIES is defined as YES, the following accounting entries are raised:

address.p: Debit Customer account for Charges USD100

desc.address:
Debit Customer account for tax
USD10

Credit P&L Account for charge
USD100

Credit Internal account for tax
USD10
desc.p: The debit of USD100 for charges and USD10 for tax can be combined into a single debit as USD110, by using the combine transaction feature of TRANSACTION, as explained below.
If SPLIT.CHRG.ENTRIES were left blank, the entries would be raised as below
desc.address:
Credit P&L Account for charge
USD100

Credit Internal account for tax
USD10

address.p: The charges and tax entries that are split from the main transaction, alone, can be combined as a single entry by using the fields COMBINE.PROD.CAT, COMBINE.SYSTEM.ID and COMBINE.TXN by selecting one of the TRANSACTION codes relating to the charges.

TELLER. PARAMETER
MAX. TILLS
Input is mandatory if the Multi. Tills field is flagged as Yes. Otherwise No input field.
Should be read along with Multi. Tills field.
If multi tills is Yes and this field is input as 4- it means any user can have a maximum of 4 tills open at any point of time.
Input can be a number between 1-99
Input permitted only if Multi tills field is flagged as Yes.
Specifies the category code which defines the cash account to post the till shortages.
When there is a till shortage the system balance can be adjusted by transferring the amount to the short account. The short account is defined by currency, category and teller id.
5 Numeric characters.
Must be a valid category code in the range 10,000 - 19,999
Reserved for future use.

Reserved for future use.

Field to indicate if denomination units inputted in TELLER.ID during till closure treat this as final stock with teller and overwrite the TT.STOCK.CONTROL.
If the value is YES update the TT.STOCK.CONTROL according to the denomination units entered in TELLER.ID during till closure.
If the value is null itâ€™s an exising functionality which will raise an override to the extent of shortage or overage of balances
and raise an entry to that extent but not update TT.STOCK.CONTROL.
Optional input.
Allowed Values: YES or NULL
Default Value: NULL

For multi-line Teller deals it is possible to set a default here so that when the Teller finishes one leg of a multi-line deal the system automatically starts a new leg or prompts each time asking whether to create a new one of finish.
Acceptable values here are YES, NO or blank.
Yes - indicates that a new leg should be started automatically.
NO or blank - means the Teller should be prompted each time.
Values of YES, NO or blank allowed
Used to identify transactions which require the an interface to the sutocash dispenser.

Any transactions which post entries to this category will invoke the autocash interface if a dispenser has been installed (See TELLER.ID AUTOCASH.DEVICE). Normally this should be the same as the cash category defined in field 5.1 TRAN.CATEGORY.
The decision to invoke the autocash interface is based on a withdrawal against this category if the TELLER.ID record indicates a device is installed.
6 Numeric characters (Optional)
Must be a valid entry on the CATEGORY file and must be in the range 10,000 to 19,999.
When SIDE1 of TELLER transactions is multi-valued, then this field indicates the amount against which denomination has to be checked with
When the Value is YES, the total denomination units in the TELLER transaction will be checked with the amount flagged against the account for which the STOCK.CONTROL.TYPE is set.
When this field is null, the total denomination units in the TELLER transaction will be checked against the total transaction amount.
Can hold values of YES or Null
